## Summary

Fix the JS release workflow failure by adding `--legacy-peer-deps` flag to npm install commands in release scripts.

### Root Cause
The release scripts (`changeset-version.mjs` and `instant-version-bump.mjs`) were running `npm install --package-lock-only` without the `--legacy-peer-deps` flag, causing npm ERESOLVE errors due to peer dependency conflicts between solid-js versions.

### Changes
- Add `--legacy-peer-deps` flag to `scripts/changeset-version.mjs`
- Add `--legacy-peer-deps` flag to `scripts/instant-version-bump.mjs`
- Add case study documentation with root cause analysis in `docs/case-studies/issue-111/`

### Test Plan
- [x] Local lint and format checks pass
- [ ] CI workflow passes on this PR
- [ ] Release workflow should no longer fail with npm ERESOLVE errors

## Issue Reference
Fixes #111
